mods.note: Gumbo Magazine initially was a triannual publication issued by the Department of Student Media. It expanded to quarterly frequency in the fall of 1992 after the Gumbo yearbook was discontinued for lack of funding. For the next two years, Gumbo Magazine took up the task of recording an historical account of the year as the yearbook had done, while continuing much of its traditional magazine feature content. The Gumbo yearbook returned in the 1994/95 academic year, freeing the magazine to return to its former practice of covering interesting people and subjects on campus. It changed its name to Legacy in 1994.
mods.abstract: Gumbo Magazine was a publication of the Department of Student Media between 1989 and 1994. It recorded an historical account of the year when the Gumbo yearbook was not published between 1992 and 1994.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
